```{r}
#| include: false

#### Load Library ####
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(RColorBrewer)
library(modelsummary)

#### Import cleaned_gss_2021.csv ####
cleaned_gss_2021 <-
  read.csv(here::here("./inputs/data/2021_data/cleaned_gss_2021.csv"))

```

```{r}
#| include: false

#### Ordering Highest Year of Education Achieved ####

cleaned_gss_2021$educ <- 
  factor(cleaned_gss_2021$educ, 
         levels = c("8th Grade", "9th Grade", "10th Grade", "11th Grade", "12th Grade", "1 Year of College", "2 Years of College", "3 Years of College", "4 Years of College", "5 Years of College", "6 Years of College", "7 Years of College", "8 Years of College"))

```


```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: fig-1
#| fig-cap: "Respondent's Sex by Highest Year of Education Achieved"

#### Creating Graph to Compare Sex Against Year of Completed Education ####

cleaned_gss_2021 |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = sex, fill = educ)) +
  geom_bar() + 
  theme_classic() +
  labs(x = "Sex",
       y = "Number",
       fill = "Highest Year of Education Completed")+
  theme(legend.key.size = unit(1,"line"))

```

```{r}
#| include: false

#### Ordering ####

cleaned_gss_2021$degree <- 
  factor(cleaned_gss_2021$degree, 
         levels = c("Less Than High School", "High School", "Associate / Junior College", "Bachelors Degree", "Graduate Degree"))

```


```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: fig-2
#| fig-cap: "Respondent's Sex by Highest Level of Education"

#### Creating Graph to Compare Sex Against Level of Education ####

cleaned_gss_2021 |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = sex, fill = degree)) +
  geom_bar() + 
  theme_classic() +
  labs(x = "Sex",
       y = "Number",
       fill = "Degree")+
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel1")

```



```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: fig-3
#| fig-cap: "Respondent's Sex by Highest Level of Education"

#### Creating Graph to Compare Sex Against Level of Education ####

cleaned_gss_2021 |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = sex, fill = richwork)) +
  geom_bar() + 
  theme_classic() +
  labs(x = "Sex",
       y = "Number",
       fill = "Rich Work")+
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel1")
```

```{r}
#| include: false

#### Ordering ####

cleaned_gss_2021$satjob <- 
  factor(cleaned_gss_2021$satjob, 
         levels = c("Very Satisfied", "Moderately Satisfied", "A Little Dissatisfied", "Very Dissatisfied"))
```


```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: fig-4
#| fig-cap: "Respondent's Sex by Job Satisfaction"

#### Creating Graph to Compare Sex Against Job Satisfaction ####

cleaned_gss_2021 |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = sex, fill = satjob)) +
  geom_bar() + 
  theme_classic() +
  labs(x = "Sex",
       y = "Number",
       fill = "Job Satisfaction")+
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel1")
```


```{r}
#| include: false

#### Ordering ####

cleaned_gss_2021$finrela <- 
  factor(cleaned_gss_2021$finrela, 
         levels = c("Far Above Average", "Above Average", "Average", "Below Average", "Far Below Average"))
```


```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: fig-5
#| fig-cap: "Respondent's Sex by Self-Defined Financial Ranking Against Other US Families"

#### Creating Graph to Compare Sex Against Self-Defined Financial Ranking Against Other US Families ####

cleaned_gss_2021 |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(x = sex, fill = finrela)) +
  geom_bar() + 
  theme_classic() +
  labs(x = "Sex",
       y = "Number",
       fill = "Rating Against Other Families")+
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel1")
```

```{r}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| label: fig-6
#| fig-cap: "Respondent's Highest Level of Education by Self-Defined Financial Ranking Against Other US Families"

#### Creating Graph to Compare Sex Against Self-Defined Financial Ranking Against Other US Families ####

cleaned_gss_2021 |>
  ggplot(mapping = aes(y = degree, fill = finrela)) +
  geom_bar() + 
  theme_classic() +
  labs(y = "Highest Level of Education",
       x = "Number",
       fill = "Rating Against Other Families")+
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Pastel1")+
  theme(legend.title = element_text(size = 6),
        legend.text= element_text(size=6))
```
